IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MIFA SUPPORTS THE INDEPENDENCE OF VULNERABLE SENIORS AND FAMILIES IN CRISIS THROUGH THE HIGH-IMPACT PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MIFA SUPPORTS THE INDEPENDENCE OF VULNERABLE SENIORS AND FAMILIES IN CRISIS THROUGH HIGH-IMPACT PROGRAMS.
IRS990.Desc: IN FY 2018 MIFA'S FOUR SENIOR PROGRAMS PROMOTED INDEPENDENCE, HEALTH, COMPANIONSHIP, AND DIGNITY THROUGH THESE SERVICES: MEALS ON WHEELS (SERVED 565,252 MEALS TO 3,615 SENIORS); TRANSIT (PROVIDED 26,200 TRIPS TO MEDICAL/DOCTOR'S OFFICES, GROCERY STORES AND CONGREGATE MEAL SITES FOR 635 SENIORS); SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (61 COMPANIONS PROVIDED 58,436 HOURS OF COMPANIONSHIP AND HELP WITH DAILY LIVING ACTIVITIES TO 88 CLIENTS); LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN (61 VOLUTEERS COMPLETED 1,280 HOURS OF SERVICE, PROVIDING ADVOCACY FOR THE CARE AND DIGNITY OF 4,177 SENIORS LIVING IN CARE HOMES).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MIFA 'S FOUR FAMILY PROGRAMS PROVIDED BASIC SERVICES TO PREVENT HOMELESSNESS, STABILIZE FAMILIES , AND ENCOURAGE INDEPENDENCE : EMERGENCY SERVICES (FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WITH RENT, MORTGAGE, AND UTILITY PAYMENTS FOR 3,573 HOUSEHOLDS AND 11,723 FOOD VOUCHERS FOR 5,611 FAMILIES); EMERGENCY SHELTER PLACEMENT (117 HOUSEHOLDS RECEIVED MEDIATION SERVICES WHILE 1,122 WERE CONNECTED WITH EMERGENCY SHELTER); HOMELESSNESS PREVENTION AND RAPID REHOUSING (258 FAMILIES WERE CONNECTED WITH PERMANENT, STABLE HOUSING); AND THE 24-HOUR HOTLINE FOR HOMELESS FAMILIES (STAFF SCREENED 7,270 CALLS REPRESENTING 7,515 ADULTS AND 9,613 CHILDREN).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE A PERMANENT SOURCE OF SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING TO ENHANCE DEVELOPMENT AND GROWTH OF MIFA PROGRAMS.
THE ASSOCIATION HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2018, AND THERE IS NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAX ASSESSMENTS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: ASSIST INDIGENTS WITH RENTS, MORTGAGE, UTILITIES, MINOR HOME MAINTENANCE AND TEENS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INITIAL INFORMATION FOR THE 990 IS COMPILED BY THE CFO. THIS INFORMATION IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE CFO AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. UPON COMPLETION OF THE FORM 990, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND CFO CONDUCT A FINAL REVIEW. THE FORM 990 IS SENT TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING EACH BOARD MEMBER AND KEY EMPLOYEE COMPLETE A DISCLOSURE ANNUALLY AND THAT SHE WILL MONITOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MIFA USED A COMPENSATION CONSULTANT (RICHARD REINHART OF FORD AND HARRISON) AND INCLUDED COMPARATIVE DATA. SINCE THEN, THERE HAVE BEEN REGULAR RAISES FOR ALL STAFF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE AND UPON REQUEST. FORM 990, THE ANNUAL AUDIT AND THE ANNUAL REPORT ARE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE WEB SITE. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS MADE AVAILABLE ON THE WEB SITE AND UPON REQUEST.
THE OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION PROCESS FOR THE AUDIT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
